result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven James Simonsen

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:37 AM Defendant Steven James Simonsen in court.  Attorney Christopher S. Hammond in court for Steven James Simonsen.  Prosecuting attorney Diane M. Donohoo in court for the State of Wisconsin. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
State has filed a motion to increase bonds in cases 22CM744 and 22CM745.
Defense indicates the deft has not had any more violations since the motion was filed.
State will defer to the court.
Defense is requesting another status date.
BTC: Will not modify bond at this time, matters adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:17 AM Defendant Steven James Simonsen in court.  Attorney Christopher S. Hammond in court for Steven James Simonsen.  Prosecuting attorney Kelly Larsen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Saige Smith. 
Deft has picked up two new files in cases 22CM744 and 22CM745.
Atty Hammond would ask to be appointed on the new files.
Court address repayment of atty fees with the deft.
BTC: Deft is to repay the County back at a rate of $100/mo beg 10-1-22, Atty Hammond is to be appointed on the new files.
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

BTC: Court appointed atty granted, will address repayment of court appointed atty fees at the next date.
Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Deft is working on hiring an atty.
BTC: Matters adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
copy of letter from State Public Defender - not eligible
State's notice of intent to introduce deft's statements
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

***ALSO $1,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND*** Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with County Inn and Suites or any employees. You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 3:00 p.m.

2:24 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary J Kotleski in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Steven James Simonsen in court. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
BTC: Vacate Warrant, Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
